[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m40[0m[34m of [0m[33m673[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m59 | [0m[35m3. Encoding the intermediate representation into a final BitString.   [0m
[30;1m60 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m61 | [0m[35mSupport for each of these steps is provided by LEPL.  Stage 1 comes from the[0m
[30;1m62 | [0m[35mgraph and node modules; 2 is provided below (leveraging BitString's class [0m
[30;1m63 | [0m[35mmethods); 3 is only supported in a simple way below, with the expectation[0m
[30;1m64 | [0m[35mthat future modules might extend both encoding and matching to, for example, [0m
[30;1m65 | [0m[35mASN.1.[0m

[30;1m42 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m43 | [0m[35mThe next simplest approach seems to be to use some kind of separate dispatch[0m
[30;1m44 | [0m[35m(rather than the classes themselves) to convert things to a standard [0m
[30;1m45 | [0m[35mintermediate fmt.  That is what I do here.  The intermediate fmt[0m
[30;1m46 | [0m[35mis the pair (type, BitString), where "type" can be any value (but will be the[0m

[30;1m48 | [0m[35mtrying to give some impression of a layered approach).[0m
[30;1m49 | [0m[35m[0m

[30;1m837 | [0m[35m        to other states.  This repeats until we have covered all the [0m

[30;1m60 | [0m[35m'''[0m

[30;1m235 | [0m[35m        so that attributes are more predictable.[0m
[30;1m236 | [0m[35m        '''[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m254[0m[34m of [0m[33m673[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m221 | [0m[35mdef KApply(matcher, function, raw=False):[0m
[30;1m222 | [0m[35m    '''[0m
[30;1m223 | [0m[35m    Apply an arbitrary function to named arguments (**\****).[0m
[30;1m224 | [0m[35m    The function should typically expect and return a list.[0m
[30;1m225 | [0m[35m    It can be used indirectly by placing ``**=`` to the right of the matcher.[0m
[30;1m226 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m227 | [0m[35m    The function will be applied with the following keyword arguments:[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m255[0m[34m of [0m[33m673[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/LEPL-5.1.3/src/lepl/matchers/derived.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m165 | [0m[35m        If a string is given, named pairs will be created (and raw and args[0m
[30;1m166 | [0m[35m        ignored).[0m
[30;1m167 | [0m[35m        [0m
[30;1m168 | [0m[35m        Otherwise the function should expect a list of results (unless [0m
[30;1m169 | [0m[35m        ``args=True`` in which case the list is supplied as ``*args``)[0m
[30;1m170 | [0m[35m        and can return any value (unless ``raw=True`` in which case it should[0m
[30;1m171 | [0m[35m        return a list).[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m256[0m[34m of [0m[33m673[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m93 | [0m[35mclass AddLexer(Rewriter):[0m
[30;1m94 | [0m[35m    '''[0m
[30;1m95 | [0m[35m    This is required when using Tokens.  It does the following:[0m
[30;1m96 | [0m[35m    - Find all tokens in the matcher graph[0m
[30;1m97 | [0m[35m    - Construct a lexer from the tokens[0m
[30;1m98 | [0m[35m    - Connect the lexer to the matcher[0m
[30;1m99 | [0m[35m    - Check that all children have a token parent [0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m267[0m[34m of [0m[33m673[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m86 | [0m[35m        if isinstance(node, BaseToken):[0m

[30;1m210 | [0m[35m    def build(self, graph, src, dest):[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m345[0m[34m of [0m[33m673[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/LEPL-5.1.3/src/lepl/matchers/operators.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m533 | [0m[35m              A depth first search is used, which tends to give longer[0m
[30;1m534 | [0m[35m              matches before shorter ones.  This tries to repeats matches [0m
[30;1m535 | [0m[35m              with the sub-matcher, consuming as much of the stream as [0m
[30;1m536 | [0m[35m              possible, before backtracking to find alternative matchers.[0m
[30;1m537 | [0m[35m              If the sub-matcher does not backtrack then this guarantees[0m
[30;1m538 | [0m[35m              that the number of matches returned will not increase (ie will[0m
[30;1m539 | [0m[35m              monotonically decrease) on backtracking.[0m

[30;1m374 | [0m[35m            default.[0m
[30;1m375 | [0m[35m            [0m
[30;1m376 | [0m[35m            Length and big-endianness are inferred from the fmt for values [0m
[30;1m377 | [0m[35m            given as strings, but explicit parameters override these.[0m
[30;1m378 | [0m[35m            If no length is given, and none can be inferred, 32 bits is assumed[0m
[30;1m379 | [0m[35m            (bit length cannot be inferred for decimal values, even as strings).[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m525[0m[34m of [0m[33m673[0m[31m ]--[0m

[30;1m120 | [0m[35m        A sequence of bits, of arbitrary length.  Has similar semantics to[0m
[30;1m121 | [0m[35m        strings, in that a single index is itself a BitString (of unit length).[0m
[30;1m122 | [0m[35m        [0m
[30;1m123 | [0m[35m        This is intended as a standard fmt for arbitrary binary data, to help[0m
[30;1m124 | [0m[35m        with conversion between other types.  In other words, convert to and from[0m
[30;1m125 | [0m[35m        this, and then chain conversions.[0m
[30;1m126 | [0m[35m        [0m

[30;1m59 | [0m[35m                   [0m
[30;1m60 | [0m[35m    `count` is the number of parses to make when measuring a single time.  This[0m
[30;1m61 | [0m[35m    is to make sure that the time taken is long enough to measure accurately[0m
[30;1m62 | [0m[35m    (times less that 10ms or so will be imprecise).  The final time reported[0m
[30;1m63 | [0m[35m    is adjusted to be for a single parse, no matter what the value of `count`.[0m
[30;1m64 | [0m[35m    By default 10 matches are made.[0m
[30;1m65 | [0m[35m    [0m

[30;1m31 | [0m[35mTests for a weird bug when writing the float (rational at the time) matcher.[0m
[30;1m32 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m33 | [0m[35mThis came down to optional entries being mapped in NFA as empty transitions [0m
[30;1m34 | [0m[35mfrom a single node.  If multiple choices were from the same node the empty[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m668[0m[34m of [0m[33m673[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000600[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m669[0m[34m of [0m[33m673[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
  Severity: [36mModerate[0m, Confidence: [36mLow[0m
  Filename: [33m/LEPL-5.1.3/src/lepl/matchers/_test/float_bug.py[0m
   Pattern: [32m\s(apt|apt\-get|aria2c|arp|ash|awk|base64|bash|bpftrace|busybox|cat|chmod|chown|cp|cpan|cpulimit|crontab|csh|curl|cut|dash|dd|diff|dmesg|dmsetup|dnf|docker|dpkg|easy_install|ed|emacs|env|expand|expect|facter|find|finger|flock|fmt|ftp|gawk|gdb|gimp|git|grep|head|iftop|ionice|ip|irb|jjs|journalctl|jrunscript|ksh|ld\.so|ldconfig|logsave|ltrace|lua|mail|mawk|mount|mtr|mv|mysql|nano|nawk|nc|nice|nl|nmap|node|od|openssl|perl|pg|php|pic|pico|pip|puppet|readelf|red|rlogin|rlwrap|rpm|rpmquery|rsync|ruby|run\-mailcap|run\-parts|rvim|scp|screen|script|sed|service|setarch|sftp|shuf|smbclient|socat|sort|sqlite3|ssh|start\-stop\-daemon|stdbuf|strace|systemctl|tail|tar|taskset|tclsh|tcpdump|tee|telnet|tftp|time|timeout|tmux|top|ul|unexpand|uniq|unshare|vi|vim|watch|wget|whois|wish|xargs|xxd|yum|zsh|zypper)\s[0m
[30;1m35 | [0m[35mtransition order was incorrect (it's ordered by node number, and the node[0m
[30;1m36 | [0m[35mfor the empty transition was created after other nodes, intead of before).[0m
[30;1m37 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m38 | [0m[35mThe fix used was to change the node creation order.  Other nodes appear to [0m
[30;1m39 | [0m[35mbe created correctly.  However, it would be better in the longer term, I[0m
[30;1m40 | [0m[35msuspect, to use an ordered dict or similar to store the empty transitions[0m
[30;1m41 | [0m[35mso that the numbering is not needed for order.[0m

[31m--[ [0m[34mMatch #[0m[33m670[0m[34m of [0m[33m673[0m[31m ]--[0m
   Rule Id: [34mBD000610[0m
       Tag: [34mSecurity.Backdoor.LOLBAS.Linux[0m
